article_title: In West Wing, Strategist Gets Wide Portfolio
article_text:
At tough moments in the Obama presidency, senior White House officials have often placed calls to a rail-thin policy wonk and Democratic Party mandarin based at a think tank in downtown Washington.

Aides invited John Podesta to lunch during the major budget fight in 2011 to ask what depth of entitlement cuts the party might bear. They called him again before the president's State of the Union address in 2012, asking for clean energy...

twitter.description: In becoming a senior White House adviser, John Podesta is joining a West Wing that has often relied on him for private guidance, and the breadth of that counsel suggests he will have a sweeping portfolio.
twitter.creator: @peterwsj

article_summary:
They called him again before the president's State of the Union address in 2012, asking for clean energy...
At tough moments in the Obama presidency, senior White House officials have often placed calls to a rail-thin policy wonk and Democratic Party mandarin based at a think tank in downtown Washington.
Aides invited John Podesta to lunch during the major budget fight in 2011 to ask what depth of entitlement cuts the party might bear.
